se;ljfkslkdjflskj


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggtext)
library(ggplot2)

bigdata <- read_csv("PremSpend.csv")
chelsea <- bigdata |> filter(Club == "Chelsea FC")
brighton <- bigdata |> filter(Club == "Brighton & Hove Albion")

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=bigdata, aes(x=reorder(Club, Expenditures), weight=Expenditures), fill = "lightgrey") +
  geom_bar(data=chelsea, aes(x=reorder(Club, Expenditures), weight=Expenditures), color = "#DBA111", fill="#034694") +
  geom_bar(data=brighton, aes(x=reorder(Club, Expenditures), weight=Expenditures), color = "lightblue", fill="#FFCD00") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="Club", 
    y="Transfer Expenses (21-24)", 
    title="The duality of club spending", 
    subtitle="Chelsea and Brighton have been on opposite sides of the transfer spending spectrum over the last three years.", 
    caption="Source: TransferMarkt | By Gus Kathol") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
     axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 











Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=bigdata, aes(x=reorder(Club, Points), weight=Points), fill = "lightgrey") +
  geom_bar(data=chelsea, aes(x=reorder(Club, Points), weight=Points), color = "#DBA111", fill="#034694") +
  geom_bar(data=brighton, aes(x=reorder(Club, Points), weight=Points), color = "lightblue", fill="#FFCD00") +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="Club", 
    y="Total Points (21-24)", 
    title="Different means, same results", 
    subtitle="While Chelsea has spent roughly one billion USD more than Brighton, they have almost the same amount of points.", 
    caption="Source: TransferMarkt | By Gus Kathol"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
     axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )









function for residuals


Code
fit <- lm(Points ~ Expenditures, data = bigdata)

premresidualmodel <- bigdata |> mutate(predicted = predict(fit), residuals = residuals(fit))

chelsearesidual <- premresidualmodel |> filter(Club == "Chelsea FC")
brightonresidual <- premresidualmodel |> filter(Club == "Brighton & Hove Albion")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=premresidualmodel, aes(x=Expenditures, y=residuals, size = Points), color = "grey") +
  geom_point(data=chelsearesidual, aes(x=Expenditures, y=residuals, size = Points), color = "#034694") +
  geom_point(data=brightonresidual, aes(x=Expenditures, y=residuals, size = Points), color = "#FFCD00") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 319.36, color="black") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=150, y=75, label= "Low Spending | Beat Expectations"), color = "blue") + 
  geom_text(aes(x=875, y=75, label= "High Spending | Beat Expectations"), color = "blue") +
  geom_text(aes(x=150, y=-75, label= "Low Spending | Failed Expections"), color = "red") +
  geom_text(aes(x=1000, y=-75, label= "Corner of Shame"), color = "red") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=chelsearesidual, 
    aes(x=Expenditures, y=residuals, label=Club)) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=brightonresidual, 
    aes(x=Expenditures, y=residuals, label=Club)) +
  labs(
    x="Transfer Expenses (21-24)", 
    y="Residual Points", 
    title="The good, the bad, and the horrendous", 
    subtitle="Chelsea and Brighton have scored a similar amount of points, and vastly defied expectations.", 
    caption="Source: TransferMarkt | By Gus Kathol"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )
